term.title: migration

item.text: The (usually intramolecular) transfer of an atom or group during the course of a molecular rearrangement.
The movement of a bond to a new position, within the same molecular entity is known as 'bond migration'. Allylic rearrangements, e.g. [image: Not defined] exemplify both types of migration.

term.sources: 'Glossary of terms used in physical organic chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' Muller, P.; Pure and Applied Chemistry 1994 66(5) 1077

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
